Class SolidObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • sample.SolidObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BackgroundImage, Food, MovingObject, Ore
    public class SolidObject
extends java.lang.Object
    Parent function for all solid objects

      • SolidObject

        public SolidObject​(int posX,
                   int posY,
                   int objWidth,
                   int objHeight,
                   java.awt.Color objColour)
        Parameters:
        posX - - the interger position in pixels of the object - X axis
        posY - - the interger position in pixels of the object - Y axis
        objWidth - - the interger width in pixels of the object
        objHeight - - the interger height in pixels of the object
        objColour - the color of the object in the class 'Color'

      • SolidObject

        public SolidObject​(int objWidth,
                   int objHeight,
                   int posX,
                   int posY,
                   java.awt.Color objColour,
                   java.awt.image.BufferedImage r_Image,
                   java.awt.image.BufferedImage l_Image,
                   java.awt.image.BufferedImage up_Image,
                   java.awt.image.BufferedImage down_Image)
        Parameters:
        posX - - the interger position in pixels of the object - X axis
        posY - - the interger position in pixels of the object - Y axis
        objWidth - - the interger width in pixels of the object
        objHeight - - the interger height in pixels of the object
        objColour - the color of the object in the class 'Color'
        r_Image - - the image to draw when the object is moving / facing right
        l_Image - - the image to draw when the object is moving / facing left
        up_Image - - the image to draw when the object is moving / facing up
        down_Image - - the image to draw when the object is moving / facing down

    • Method Detail

      • drawobj

        public void drawobj​(java.awt.Graphics2D gg,
                    Map maps)
        given a 2d Graphics graw the object in reference to viewX and viewY of the MapView Eg: object 0,0 and the mapview 1,1 draw the object @ -1,-1 Additionally scale the object in comparision to the width and height of the map view to allow objects to appear to get bigger / smaller as the zoom changes
        Parameters:
        gg - - the Graphics 2D that the object is drawn on
        maps - - the Map that is used to draw the object relatively to the view X, Y positions

      • unCompensateddrawobj

        public void unCompensateddrawobj​(java.awt.Graphics2D gg)
        Parameters:
        gg - - the Graphics 2D that the object is drawn on

        public boolean isBelow​(SolidObject sam)
        Parameters:
        sam - the SolidObject to compare to to determine if they are colliding
        Returns:
        true when 'this' object is entirely above sam
